result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Corey R Gatson Bridges

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on February 3, 2023 at 09:30 am.

9:13 AM Defendant Corey R Gatson Bridges in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Corey R Gatson Bridges. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense requests a plea/sentencing hearing in 30-45 days. Court sets.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives. Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.

**AMENDEMENT MADE: Court will remove the requirement that the Defendant have a Waukesha County GPS bracelet, but is required to comply with GPS monitoring with Justice Point on Milwaukee County case, and remain at least 500 feet away from BLF. **

10:47 AM Defendant Corey R Gatson Bridges in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Court to address WCS non-compliance and Motion for Bond Modification filed on 07/22/2022.  

State makes arguments in support of GPS monitoring and cash bail remaining as set. 

Defense makes arguments in support of removal of GPS monitoring. 

Court will remove the requirement that the Defendant have a Waukesha County GPS bracelet, but is required to comply with GPS monitoring with Justice Point on Milwaukee County case, and remain at least 500 feet away from BLF.

State requests that the Defendant make a payment for the outstanding balance to WCS for Waukesha County GPS monitoring. Defendant to pay for monitoring that he has had.
Motion for Bond Modification, filed by Attorney Griffis.
Bail/bond hearing on July 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 7/20/2022 received and filed. Defendant is noncompliant with payment expectations.
**Reviewed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 7/20/2022 - Set for bail/bond hearing on Monday, 7/25/2022 at 10:30 AM. If defendant makes payment arrangements with WCS and the Court is notified by Monday morning, the hearing will be cancelled.**
Hearing on September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Julian Marrufo, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Corey R Gatson Bridges in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.   

Defense is still waiting on digital discovery and have their investigator look into  an issue.
  Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on July 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

08:43 AM Defendant Corey R Gatson Bridges in court with attorney Patrick Sicula on behalf of Justin G Griffis.  Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for Arraignment.
State has filed Information.
Defense acknowledges receipt of Information and waives reading.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Defense requests outstanding discovery. 
  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Arraignment on June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:41 AM
Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Corey R Gatson Bridges in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.  

State will be dismissing count 1 at arraignment.
Defense has no objections.

Matter is still contested, and will proceed to preliminary hearing as to counts 2 & 3 only.
Neither the State nor Defense presented opening statements.
Matter proceeds directly to testimony.

Witness Called:  Officer Samantha Blank (City of Brookfield Police Department).
Witness Sworn and Testified.

Testimony Deemed Closed.
State requests bind over.
Defense objects to bind.

Court finds the State has met their burden of proof as to Counts 2 & 3 ONLY.
There is probable cause that a felony was committed and that the defendant is the one that committed the felony.
Court binds the matter over for trial.

Bail remains as fixed.
Information filed.
Matter set over for Arraignment.  
Arraignment scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

02:10 PM Defendant Corey R Gatson Bridges in court, in custody.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  James Bridges appearing in court stating that the defendant will need to be evaluated by the public defender's office.  Defendant will not be retaining Atty. Hart for this case.  Defendant requests an adjournment of the preliminary hearing set for 5/18/2022.  Court adjourns.    Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Bail remains as fixed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant given two petitions for the appointment of counsel.  Court will allow James Bridges (defendant's father) to appear by zoom for the next hearing. 02:17 PM Defendant Corey R Gatson Bridges in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Alyssa Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The defendant states he has retained Attorney Michael Hart as private counsel.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A listed in the Victim Identification Key.
